title: 版塊設計商業研究案, Block Design Business Research Case
subtitle: 幫助客戶了解數位產業工作者對於『網站動態特效』的認知、學習目標、產業理解 To help clients understand the knowledge, learning objectives, and industry understanding of digital industry workers on Web Site Dynamic Effects.
html:
設計流程 Process

發現 Discover

在這個階段是透過桌面研究去搜集相關資料，並且將這些資料透過商業假設去確認這些商業假設都有從產品面向和使用者面向出發去設想。

  • 桌面研究
  • 商業假設
  • 篩選重要議題
  • 議題拆解
  • 當我學會網站動態特效，我想要轉職/升職，我可以獲得更多的薪水
  • 當我學會網站動態特效，我想要有更高的話語權，我可以和工程師溝通
  • ...
  • 當我提供更好的課程體驗，我能夠留住更多學生，讓更多學生可以上完整堂課程
  • 當我了解學員在學習網站動態特效的痛點，我能夠提供更加精確的課程內容，讓課程可以真正幫助到有在學習的學員
  • ...

At this stage, information is gathered through desktop research, and these data are examined through business assumptions, considering both product and user perspectives.

  • Desktop Research
  • Business Assumptions
  • Filtering Key Issues
  • Breaking Down Issues
  • When I master website dynamic effects, I set a aim to switch jobs/promotions to secure a higher salary.
  • Upon being proficiency in website dynamic effects, I am looking forward to having better communicarion with engineers.
  • ...
  • By providing an enhanced course experience, I can retain more students, enabling them to complete the entire course.
  • When I Understand the pain points of learners in mastering website dynamic effects, I can deliver more precise course content to genuinely assist students in their learning journey.
  • ...

定義 Define

使用者研究
  • 招募問券
  • 使用者訪談
  • 透過招募問券的跳題邏輯了解他們學習的目的、學習需求、對產業的看法等
  • 並且從中篩選出6位符合資格條件的受訪者，進階去挖掘他們對於學習的看法、學習的痛點、學習的關鍵事件等等
研究洞見
  • 訪談切片
  • 資料分析
  • 親合圖
  • 研究發現
  • 透過親合圖的第一層去發現許多切片的研究發現（隱性關聯）
  • 從多個研究發現去找到背後的問題/目標
  • 工作上遇到的問題是促進積極學習的助力
  • 學員需要全方位的學習，才能迎接下一次的挑戰
  • 換個角度切入設計人才的選課規劃
User Research
  • Recruitment Questionnaire
  • User Interviews
  • Through the skip logic in the recruitment questionnaire, I can understand their learning objectives, learning needs, perspectives and so on on the industry..
  • We also selected 6 eligible respondents to further explore their views on learning, learning pain points, learning key events, etc.
Research Insights
  • Interview Segmentation
  • Data Analysis
  • Affinity Diagram
  • Research Findings
  • Discovering many slices of research findings through the first layer of the affinity diagram (implicit associations)
  • Identifying underlying issues/goals from multiple research findings.
  • Problems encountered at work could be a assistance to learn hard.
  • Learners require a comprehensive learning experience to prepare for the next challenge.
  • A Different Perspective on Course Selection Planning for Design Talents

總結 Conclusion

這是一個比較偏向前期的商業研究案，還在雙鑽石的第一顆鑽石的部分，主要在驗證一開始所設定的研究目標的部分，透過扎實的研究計畫去驗證一開始訂定的研究假設，從驗證假設去幫助客戶少走很多冤枉路，讓客戶能夠透過這次的商業研究去正確定義使用者需求。

This is a business research project primarily focused on the early stages,still within the first diamond of the double diamond，aimed at validating research objectives set at the biginning.Through a solid research program to verify the initial research assumptions, from the verification of the assumptions to help the client to save a lot of time, so that the client can be through this business research to define the user needs precisely.

title: WhatsTap - 通訊 APP Design , Chatting APP Design
subtitle: 幫助客戶確認通話的各種功能以及情境測試下都是正常的 To help customers confirm that calls are functioning properly under various scenario.
html:
設計流程 Process

設計 Design

這個設計，客戶已經有一些既定的要求跟喜歡的設計樣式版型，我們主要著重的部分是他的功能面，確保每個功能都是順利且針對給予的動作會給予相對應合理的回饋。

For this design, the client already has some established requirements and preferred design patterns, and our main focus is on the functionality to ensure that each function is smooth and that the action given will give a corresponding and reasonable feedback.

交付 Deliver

  • 易用性測試
  • 極限狀態測試
  • 透過易用性測試去測試每個功能從執行到結束的合理流程
  • 透過極限狀態去從各種角度去測試功能的極限性，包含斷線狀態、載入中跳走、無人接聽等等
  • Usability testing
  • Extreme testing
  • Conducting usability testing to assess the logical flow of each feature from initiation to completion.
  • Through extreme condition to test their functions from different perspectives, including scenarios such as disconnection, navigating away during loading, and scenarios with no one answering.

頁面介紹 Page Introduction

聊天列表 Chat List

聊天列表配合使用者的使用習慣，左滑移動可以選擇將聊天置頂、靜音、刪除等功能，讓使用者可以去更輕易地將找到常用聯絡人，以及一些比較不想被打擾時，可以將一些訊息設定為靜音狀態。

The chat list is designed to align with the user's habits. Users can perform left-swipe actions to choose options such as pinning, muting, or deleting a chat, getting an easy access to frequently contacted individuals. Additionally, this allows users to mute specific messages when they prefer not to be disturbed.

聊天畫面 Chat screen

了解使用者的聊天習慣，聊天功能包含傳送照片、影片、文件、位置等等；聊天形式也包含語音聊天、視訊聊天、以及加密聊天；使用者習慣常用的長按訊息會有的相對應得功能等等。

Understanding users' chatting habits, chatting functions include sending photos, videos, files, locations and so on; chatting forms include voice chat, video chat, and encrypted chat; users are used to commonly used long-pressing messages will have corresponding functions and so on.

通話功能 Calling Functions

在通話上面，需要去考量每種通話狀態，包含撥出狀態、來電狀態、已接聽狀態、縮小狀態等等。

On the call side, we have to consider each call status, including outgoing status, incoming status, answered status, shrunken status, and so on.

視訊通話 Video Calls

在視訊上面，相對應於通話，視訊也需要去考量每種視訊狀態，包含撥出狀態、來電狀態、已接聽狀態、縮小狀態等等。

In terms of video calls, compared to phone calls, video calls also needs to take into account each video status, including outgoing status, incoming call status, answered status, reduced status, and so on.

加密通話 Encrypted Calls

在加密通話中需要著重他的隱私性，需要告知使用者使用規則，確保訊息是加密狀態的。讓使用者明白訊息是會再被看過之後，被銷毀的。

In an encrypted call, it is important to emphasize its privacy, to inform the user of the rules of usage, and to ensure that the message is encrypted. Let the user understand that the message will be destroyed after it has been viewed.

其他頁面 Other Pages

title: pdf電子簽名, Signature remotely online
subtitle: 幫助客戶不用到現場就可以遠端與客戶的顧客簽約並且線上簽名完後就可以回傳給客戶。It helps customers to sign with their customers remotely without arriving on site, and then send the signature back to the customer after signing online.
html:
設計流程 Process

發現 Discover

背景

客戶本來都需要約時間到現場與顧客面對面簽約，不過客戶有時候待在公司的時間比較少，所以想說有沒有辦法線上就可以與客戶簽署電子合約，打破時空與時間的限制，讓客戶可以不用到公司就可以與顧客進行簽約，特別是電子簽名這部分。

Bckground

Customers originally need to make an appointment to to sign contracts with her customers face to face on site,but the time customer stayed in company is less, so she would like to sign an electronic contract with the customer online, to break the limitations of time and space and time, so that the customer may not be have to come to the company and also can sign contracts with her customers online.

挑戰

  1. 1. 在有限的預算內達成符合客戶需求的產品
  2. 2. 利用UX Research去解決客戶在後台（編輯pdf)可能會遇到的問題，以及顧客在前台（簽署電子簽名）可能會遇到的問題

Challenge

  1. 1. Develop products that meet customer needs within a limited budget
  2. 2. Taking advantage to UX Research to solve problems that customers may encounter in the back end (editing pdfs) and in the front end (signing e-signatures).

定義 Define

使用者研究

  1. 桌面研究
透過研究市面上相似產品的流程與功能，理解功能的易用性流程，理解哪些部份對於使用者而言是好用的功能，並且在符合客戶預算的情況下，工程師不需要花費很大的研究成本就可以達成
  1. 任務拆解
  2. 使用者故事
  3. 使用者流程桌面研究
理解每個任務背後的流程與可能會遇到的痛點（包含：客戶編輯pdf、客戶收到顧客的回覆...），理解使用者的任務進而去做出符合使用者需求的流程，並且去分類這個階段哪些功能是必要功能、哪些功能可以留待下次優化在執行。

User research

  1. Desk Research
By researching the processes and functions of similar products on the market, we can understand the usability process of the functions, understand which parts of the functions are good for the users, and can be achieved by the engineers without spending a lot of research cost within the customer's budget.
  1. Task Dreakdown
  2. User Story
  3. User flow desktop research
Understand the process behind each task and the pain points that may be encountered (including: customers editing pdfs, customers receiving consumers feedback ...) Understand the user's task and furthermore make a process that meets the user's needs, and categorize what functions are necessary at this stage and what functions can be left for the next optimization to be implemented.

設計 Design

wireframe

透過wireframe去了解每個功能擺放的位置與對應的頁面，也方便透過wireframe去跟工程師溝通畫面，確認雙方的認知是一致的。也確認是否每一個使用者的任務都有被考慮進來，每個需求都有適當地獲得解決。

Through the wireframe to understand the position of each function and its corresponding page, it is also convenient to communicate with engineers through the wireframe to confirm that we have the same understanding. It also confirms that each user's task has been taken into consideration and that each demand has been appropriately solved.

mockup

後台：客戶編輯完pdf後，會產一組連結，讓客戶可以轉傳給顧客

Backend: After the customer has finished editing the pdf, a set of links will be generated, so that the customer can be forwarded to the customer.

後台：客戶可以查看顧客回覆的內容

前台：顧客取得連結後可以線上簽署文件，簽署完成後即會回傳給客戶

Front Desk: Consumers can sign the document online after receiving the link, and it will be sent back to the customer after the signature is completed.

Style Guide

在創作視覺稿的同時，也一邊整理設計稿的設計準則，若是產品需要擴增新的頁面，一方面可以依照準則去擴充頁面，一方面交付給工程師，他們也比較有一依循的方向在製作元件上面。

At the same time of creating the visual draft, I also organize the design criteria of the draft, if the product needs to expand the new page, on the one hand, I can follow the criteria to expand the page, on the other hand, I can deliver it to the engineers, so that they have a better direction to follow in producing the components.

交付 Deliver

測試與迭代

完成開發後，協助工程師去測試每個流程的流暢度以及在不同的裝置間轉換是否都可以順利達成任務。由此發現若是在哪些裝置上會出現哪些問題，最後再與工程師溝通協調以此去找出最小變動的方式去改善以進行迭代。

Testing and Iteration

After completing the development, I assisted the engineers to test the smoothness of each process and whether the tasks can be accomplished smoothly while switching between different devices. From this way, I can find out what problems may occur on which devices, and then communicate and coordinate with engineers to find out how to minimize the changes to improve the process for iteration.

交付

確認完每個步驟都沒問題後，就會交付予客戶，並且針對目前的流程去對客戶進行一個簡易的後台教學。

Delivery

After confirming that each step is okay, I deliver it to the client and give them an easy back-end tutorial on the current process.

title: 規劃旅程的小幫手：Google App Redesign | UIUX Case Study
subtitle: 規劃旅程不需要切換多個工具，在google Map上面就可以一次完成 No need to switch tools to plan your trip, you can do it all in Google Map!
html:
設計流程 Process

發現 Discover

痛點

Google Maps是每部手機內置的應用程序，無論何時有地圖相關的需求，用戶都會打開Google Maps。因此，在規劃旅程路線時，人們自然會考慮直接使用Google Maps。畢竟，規劃旅程的過程就像是日常從A地到B地的路線圖，只是路線中的斷點增加了好幾個。此外，Google Maps本身在路線的交通選擇上，包括了目前已知的多種交通工具，而使用者產生的大量數據也使參考時間更加準確。 Google Maps上也提供了多種類別，方便使用者依照類別尋找地點。

然而，目前的Google Maps好像缺少其他旅遊規劃應用程式所具備的功能，例如根據旅遊天數來製定旅遊路線以及在路線中設置多個斷點。這種缺失可能限制了使用者在更具體和複雜的旅遊計劃中的靈活性。因此，我們認為提供這樣的功能將進一步豐富Google Maps的使用體驗，使使用者能夠更方便地根據他們的旅行需求進行詳細的路線規劃。

Pain Point

Google Maps is a built-in application on every cell phone, so whenever you need a map, you will open Google Maps, and naturally, you will consider using Google Maps when you plan your route; after all, the process of planning a trip is just like a daily route map from A to B, with a few more breakpoints in the route. In addition, Google Maps itself includes a lots of transportation options for routes, and the large amount of data generated by users makes referencing times more accurate. Google Maps also provides a variety of categories, which makes it easy for users to find locations according to the categories.

However, the current Google Maps seems to lack features found in other travel planning applications, such as the ability to create travel routes based on the number of traveled days and the ability to place multiple breakpoints in the route. This weakness may limit the user's flexibility in more specific and complex travel plans. Therefore, we believe that providing such functionality would further enrich the experience of using Google Maps by making it easier for users to make detailed itineraries based on their travel needs .

目標

深入瞭解使用者對於旅遊規劃的期望和經驗，以及他們通常如何進行旅遊規劃。透過與其他相關應用程式的功能進行比較，我們致力於將Google Maps進行優化，以提供更符合使用者期望的友善介面，使其更適用於旅遊規劃的需求。

Goal

Gain a deeper understanding of users' expectations and experiences about travel planning and how they usually plan their trips. Through comparing the functionality of Google Maps with other related applications, we dedicated ourselves to optimizing Google Maps to provide a user-friendly interface that better meets users' expectations and makes it more suitable for travel planning needs.

定義 Define

競品分析

透過在網路上搜尋，查看一般規劃旅行，會去使用的幾款APP和網頁，透過實際去使用比對他們的功能，以規劃旅行這個角度出發去檢視每個產品的易用性、方便性、以及最後的達成度，從中去發現可以優化的部分與可以參考的部分。

Competitive Analysis

By searching on the internet and checking the several apps and webpages that are generally used for travel planning, and by comparing their functions through actual use, we examine the usability, convenience, and final achievement of each product from the perspective of travel planning, and find out the parts that can be optimized and the parts that can be used for reference from this perspective.

使用者訪談

透過剛剛的競品分析，透過比較已經可以大致上了解每個產品的優點和缺點，不過這時候還是要透過訪談這種質性研究，去驗證使用者的真正想法。

User Interviews

Through the competition analysis just now, we can already understand the strengths and weaknesses of each product, but it is still necessary to verify what users really think through qualitative research such as interviews.

受訪者
  • 人數：5位
  • 年齡：25–35
  • 共通點：近半年都有去旅遊的經驗
Respondent
  • Number of people: 5
  • Age：25–35
  • Commonality: experience of traveling during the last six months
問題
  • 目前使用什麼方式規劃旅遊？請敘述一下規劃流程？（為什麼會用這種方式規劃）
  • 在規劃旅程的過程中，你最常做的事情是什麼？（為什麼這件事你最常做）
  • 透過哪些方式或者手段搜集（景點或餐廳）（住宿）的相關資料？（為什麼用這些方式）
  • 擁有哪些3C產品？旅行過程中會怎麼使用這些3C產品呢？（為什麼？）
  • 最後一次旅行時什麼時候？過程中遇到什麼困難？怎麼解決的？（為什麼這件事最常做）
Questions
  • What is the method currently used to plan a trip?Please describe your planning process? (Why did you plan in this way?)
  • What do you do most often in the process of planning your journey? (Why did you do this most often?)
  • What are the ways to collect information about attraction or restaurant or accommodation? (Why did you use these methods?)
  • What 3C products do you have? How do you use them while traveling? (Why?)
  • When was your last travel? What difficulties did you encounter during the trip? How did you solve it? （Why did you do this most often?)

親合圖

透過剛剛的競品分析，透過比較已經可以大致上了解每個產品的優點和缺點，不從訪談中獲取的資料，透過將相似意思的便利貼歸納與整理，去精煉粹取出受訪者真正的想法（洞見）過這時候還是要透過訪談這種質性研究，去驗證使用者的真正想法。

Affinity Diagram

Through the competition analysis just now, I can already understand the advantages and disadvantages of each product, but from the interviews obtained information, I can refine and extract the real ideas (insight) of the respondents through the similar meaning of the Post-it notes to summarize and organize, and then it is necessary to verify the user's real ideas through the interviews such as the qualitative research.

以上是從眾多便利貼得出的詮釋，其中與本次專案有高度相關的部分用粉色便利貼及匡線標示起來。

The interpretation is derived from numerous Post-it notes, of which those that are highly relevant to this project are marked with a pink Post-it note and a boxed line.

從這些框起來的便利貼中（詮釋），我們又可以將一些相似的便利貼歸類在一起，得出以下洞見。

From these framed sticky notes (interpretations), we can collect a number of similar sticky notes to be gained together and come up with the following insights.

使用者旅行規劃的行為
  • 使用者會先記錄旅行計劃，然後將這些點標示在地圖上
  • 使用者會追蹤旅行相關的內容，並將喜歡的景點或餐廳存起來
User Travel Planning Behavior
  • The user will record a travel plan and then mark these points on the map
  • Users will keep track of travel-related content and save favorite attractions or restaurants.
使用者在旅行中的行為
  • 使用者在旅行途中會使用google地圖查看地點的位置和距離
  • 使用者會攜帶手機以便查看手機查看地點、拍照和發文
User behavior while traveling
  • Users use google maps to check the location and distance of places while traveling.
  • Users will carry a cell phone to check locations, take photos, and post content.
使用者在住宿的需求
  • 使用者在找住宿時會查看評價，尤其是負評。
Users' needs in accommodation
  • Users check reviews, especially negative ones, when looking for accommodation.

使用者輪廓（Persona）

使用者旅程地圖（User Journey Map））

使用者路徑（User Flow）

設計 Design

wireframe

Style Guide 設計規範

Feature Intro 功能介紹

總結 Conclusion

這次的Google Map重新設計主要專注於旅程規劃功能，因此頁面的修改主要著眼於這個功能頁面的改進。透過使用者訪談，我們真正深入了解使用者在規劃旅行和旅途中的行為及困擾，以使用者的角度優化產品。在整理使用者見解的過程中，我們發現有多個層面可以進行優化，但類似產品迭代的概念，一次只能有一個主要的方向，無法一次性優化所有功能。儘管如此，這次迭代確實從使用者訪談中獲得了許多寶貴的見解。


透過使用者訪談，我們瞭解到使用者在規劃旅途和旅途中的常見行為，並透過競品分析了解實現這些功能的方法。由於我最近正在計畫旅行，使用每個產品的過程中深刻體會到各種功能的優勢和不足。這使我能夠明確了解哪些功能使用起來更順暢，哪些時候會感到卡頓。透過優化，我們不僅確保產品達到使用者的期望，還能夠有效地在其中完成任務。

This redesign of Google Map focuses on the trip planning feature, so the changes of the page mainly focus on the improvement of this feature. Through user interviews, I was able to gain a deeper understanding of user behaviors and frustrations in trip planning and on-the-go, and optimize the product from the user's point of view. In the process of compiling user insights, I found that there were multiple levels that could be optimized, but similar to the concept of product iteration, there is only one main direction at a time, and it is not possible to optimize all features at once. Nevertheless, this iteration did gain many valuable insights from the user interviews.


Through user interviews, I learned about common user behaviors in planning trips and on-the-go, and through competitor analysis, I learned that those ways implement these features. As I was recently planning a trip, I used each product to realize the strengths and weaknesses of each feature. This enabled me to understand exactly which features worked better and when they would lag. By optimizing, I am not only ensuring that the products meet the user's expectations, but also that I am able to effectively accomplish tasks at the same time.
